bill_title: require the use of certain oxygenated fuel and to revise the ethanol motor fuel tax.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require the use of certain oxygenated fuel and to revise the ethanol motor fuel tax. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. After July 1, 2004, all gasoline sold or offered for sale in this state shall contain at least 2.7 percent oxygen by weight. Section 2. A person responsible for the product may offer for sale, sell, or dispense at an airport, marina, mooring facility, or resort, for use in airplanes or for purposes listed under section 4 of this Act, gasoline that is not oxygenated in accordance with section 1 of this Act if the gasoline is unleaded premium grade. Section 3. A person responsible for the product may offer for sale, sell, or dispense at a public or private racecourse, gasoline that is not oxygenated in accordance with section 1 of this Act if the gasoline is intended to be used exclusively as a fuel for off-highway motor sports racing events. Section 4. A person responsible for the product may offer for sale, sell, or dispense at a retail gasoline station for use in collector vehicles or vehicles eligible to be licensed as collector vehicles, off-road vehicles, motorcycles, boats, snowmobiles, or small engines, gasoline that is not oxygenated in accordance with section 1 of this Act. If the nonoxygenated gasoline is for use in a small engine, it must be dispensed into a can with a capacity of six or fewer gallons. Section 5. A person responsible for the product may offer for sale, sell, and deliver directly to a bulk fuel storage tank gasoline that is not oxygenated in accordance with section 1 of this Act for use in aircraft if the nonoxygenated gasoline is unleaded premium grade. Section 6. That § 10-47B-4 be amended to read as follows: 10-47B-4. The fuel excise tax rates for the tax imposed by this chapter are as follows: (1) Motor fuel (except ethanol blends, E85 and M85 blends, and aviation gasoline) $.22 per gallon; (2) Special fuel (except jet fuel) -- $.22 per gallon; (3) Ethanol blends -- $.20 $.22 per gallon; (4) Aviation gasoline -$.06 per gallon; (5) Jet fuel -$.04 per gallon; (6) E85 and M85 -- $.10 per gallon; (7) E85 and M85 used in aircraft -$.04 per gallon; (8) Liquid petroleum gas -- $.20 per gallon; (9) Compressed natural gas -- $.10 per gallon.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
